messageBody:
Sorry if this has been covered in depth on this list before, I'm
new to the junit list.

Firstly, I would recommend writing unit tests to test your EJB class's
business logic in isolation, ie. not deployed in an EJB container
(application server). That way, you'll have a set of tests you can run
quickly to verify the business logic and that will ultimately save you a
lot of time and hassle.

Here's the general idea:

public class CustomerEJBTest extends TestCase {

public void setUp() {
CustomerBean customer = new CustomerBean();
customer.ejbCreate();
TestEJBContext ctx = new TestEJBContext(...);
customer.setInitialContext(ctx);
}

// tests .....
}

If you have EJB - EJB interactions using ejb-links, consider building
your own java: url context.

Does anyone know of any downloadable offerings for helping this kind of
unit testing?

Malcolm
